reviews.text: As part of our quick trip around Northern Ireland, we hopped on the Magilligan Ferry to Greencastle in Inisowen and headed up to Irelands most northerly accomodation..
reviews.title: Fabulously Welcoming

reviews.text: Well worth the effort as the scenery is amazing and the welcome from the Seaview Tavern equally as impressive. A nicer man than owner Michael you won't meet..Full of interesting chat and stories of the Bronz! :)
reviews.title: Our trip to malin head

reviews.text: Plenty of room for all 7 of us, in 3 really surprisingly luxurious bedrooms(considering they are over a pub !) all with seaview..
reviews.title: This restaurant is a must when visiting Inishowen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldnt complain about a thing, lovely restaurant attached to the tavern with really excellent steaks and seafood..great breakfast, but most memorable thing was the feeling of being welcome and no fuss.
reviews.title: beautiful views, relaxing stay
pest place for miles
reviews.text: Very family orientated and no issue with 5 month old baby, travel cot set up ready and waiting:)

Fab place, great room, fantastic food, but the bar has to be one of the ugliest I have seen, for a stunning location it was not inviting to stay and drink, no atmosphere definitely needs a makeover to something more Cosy
reviews.title: Horrible bar decor

reviews.text: We stayed at The Seaview tavern from Friday 3rd to Sunday 5th august and it was wonderful. An amazing situation overlooking the beaches, islands and the small harbour with the fishing boats coming and going.
reviews.title: Weekend deal at Seaview Tavern

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and the ed linine beautiful, crisp and white.
reviews.title: You won't get a better coastal view or friendlier welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was amazing! Do not be tempted to order extras, the portions are very generous. I would recommend the staek with tobacco onions...to die for!
reviews.title: The best of all (Irish lodging) worlds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cheeseboard for one was more than ample for two and a lovely selection.
reviews.title: I wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.text: I travelled here with a group of friends a bit anxious as I was aware there were many changes since my last visit.
reviews.title: A slice of heaven

reviews.text: We were greeted by Catriona our host who really went out of her way to assisst us. Catriona is an absolute gem who works, delegates, cooks and manages the staff and guests. Michael was brillant doing his tourist brief on our first morning to guide us on our travels. Unfortunaely he had to leave on business but Catriona and staff ensured we had an excellent time.
reviews.title: A little hidden gem

reviews.text: We met other guests who were equally enthralled with their holiday.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend Seaview as a haven of tranquility with excellent restaurant, very comfortable beds and an entertaining bar.
reviews.title: so disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt you entered here as a guest but left as a family member. Congratulations to Michael, Catriona and all the staff.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, would def recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a one night stay at Seaside Tavern and I wish we could have stayed longer !! Beautiful blustery scenery, sea view from our immaculate airy clean room and such warm friendly service. Decision to stay there was solely based on Trip Advisor ratings which did not let us down. Food was fantastic. We were both impressed by the seafood chowder and prawn cocktail at lunch, evening meal equally delicious, I heartily recommend the John Dory while my boyfriend's steak was mighty fine too. For lunch and evening we had the house white, of a high standard. Breakfast was hearty and tasty, the owner Michael was very welcoming and provided us with a thorough and fascinating history of the area. All in all our stay was faultless and I will be harping on at my boyfriend for a return !!
reviews.title: Stunning seaside retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reached Malin Head from the U.S. by way of Sligo and up the Donegal coast reaching Seaview on a Friday afternoon. We were blown away by the sheer beauty of the setting. The hotel above the pub looked out to the sea from our bedroom window. It was breathtaking. Our room was spacious and modern. The ensuite was equipped with a powerful shower, always a plus. Our hosts were more than accommodating , making certain we had everything we needed to feel comfortable and at home. Michael has lived in the States and And relates well to Americans. Of course most Irish people do. The food in the restaraunt was very good and we ate there both nights that we were there. Michael gave us recommendations as to what to see. We took all his suggestions. They were all spot on. We especially enjoyed his recommendation to go to the tower and watch the sunset. Such a wonderful time. We will never forget Malin Head and Seaview.
reviews.title: Such fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night during a brief trip around Northern Ireland. No regrets about making the journey to Malin Head! Beautiful journey all the way through Donegal and Malin Head itself was no exception. The Seaview Tavern staff were all exceptionally friendly and welcoming, our room a warm haven away from any cool sea breezes and we had a wonderful view out over the bay.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, friendly hosts, great food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinks and food in the bar and restaurant in the evening were all good and the staff were all extremely attentive. We were delighted to have a table reserved for us with a sea view! We had similarly good service and food at breakfast, and found the added bonus of the host giving us a talk about the area, plus a guide to a short trip of the locality, really useful.
reviews.title: warm, friendly welcome in a stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No hesitation in recommending the Seaview to anybody travelling to Malin Head, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: perfection!!
